subject: Track and Field
lead_paragraph: Bernard Lagat successfully defended his 1,500 meters title Saturday at the Norwich Union International indoor meet in Glasgow.Lagat, of the United States, finished in 3:45.89 after taking the lead in the final 200. Shadrack Korir of Kenya was second, finishing in 3:46.96.The American pole-vaulter Brad Walker, 26, landed awkwardly after attempting 18 feet 4 ½ inches, the winning height for Alexander Straub of Germany. Walker said he had no broken bones but he could miss Friday’s Millrose Games in New York.The British athletes edged the United States by a point to win the meet.
